elements.content: Cooperativity in spin crossover materials as ligand's responsibility – investigations of the Fe(II) – 1,3-bis((1H-tetrazol-1-yl)methyl)bicyclo[1.1.1]pentane system†II Christian Knoll Danny Müller Marco Seifried Gerald Giester Jan M. Welch Werner Artner Klaudia Hradil Michael Reissner and Peter Weinberger II1,22,345,67–107–111213,142,32,3,157–103,16161715,18,1920,2122–243,25Synthesis of compounds 1–7. (a) NH3 (b) LiAlH4 (c) NaN3, triethyl orthoformate, acetic acid (d) Fe(BF4)2·6H2O (e) Fe(ClO4)2·6H2O (f) Fe(PF6)2.II26,2726,27Magnetic susceptibility of [Fe(ppditz)3]X2, X = BF4−, ClO4−, and PF6− in the solid state between 10 K–300 K.II22,23,28–303IISingle [Fe(ppditz)3]2+-unit of 5 and 6 in the low-spin (left, a and c) and high-spin (right, b and d).3132–35Waterfall-plot of the temperature-dependent P-XRD data of 5. The spin crossover associated volume work is observed at 173 K due to the shift of the peak positions. The inserted line is meant as a guide for the eye (for P-XRD data of 6 and 7 see Fig. S19 and S20).

Fig. 3 Waterfall-plot of the temperature-dependent P-XRD data of 5. The spin crossover associated volume work is observed at 173 K due to the shift of the peak positions. The inserted line is meant as a guide for the eye (for P-XRD data of 6 and 7 see Fig. S19 and S20).
